detaileddescription.para: Convenience macro for specifying the default identity. This helps make the code more readable, especially when only one identity is supported.

briefdescription.para: Helper to declare elements of bt_data arrays.

detaileddescription.para: This macro is mainly for creating an array of struct bt_data elements which is then passed to e.g. bt_le_adv_start().

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the data field payload
Number of bytes behind the _data pointer

briefdescription.para: Helper to declare elements of bt_data arrays.

detaileddescription.para: This macro is mainly for creating an array of struct bt_data elements which is then passed to e.g. bt_le_adv_start().

parameterdescription.para: Peer address, set to NULL for undirected advertising or address of peer for directed advertising.

briefdescription.para: Helper to declare advertising parameters inline.

parameterdescription.para: Peer address, set to NULL for undirected advertising or address of peer for directed advertising.

Helper to initialize extended advertising start parameters inline
Helper to declare extended advertising start parameters inline
Helper to declare periodic advertising parameters inline
Helper to declare periodic advertising parameters inline

briefdescription.para: Helper to declare scan parameters inline.
Helper macro to enable active scanning to discover new devices.
Helper macro to enable passive scanning to discover new devices.

detaileddescription.para: This macro should be used if information required for device identification (e.g., UUID) are known to be placed in Advertising Data.

briefdescription.para: Helper macro to enable active scanning to discover new devices. Include scanning on Coded PHY in addition to 1M PHY.
Helper macro to enable passive scanning to discover new devices. Include scanning on Coded PHY in addition to 1M PHY.

detaileddescription.para: This macro should be used if information required for device identification (e.g., UUID) are known to be placed in Advertising Data.
Convenience value when no options are specified.

Advertise as connectable. If not connectable then the type of advertising is determined by providing scan response data. The advertiser address is determined by the type of advertising and/or enabling privacy embed:rst:inline :kconfig:option:`CONFIG_BT_PRIVACY` .

Don't try to resume connectable advertising after a connection. This option is only meaningful when used together with BT_LE_ADV_OPT_CONNECTABLE. If set the advertising will be stopped when bt_le_adv_stop() is called or when an incoming (peripheral) connection happens. If this option is not set the stack will take care of keeping advertising enabled even as connections occur. If Advertising directed or the advertiser was started with bt_le_ext_adv_start then this behavior is the default behavior and this flag has no effect.

Advertise using the identity address as the advertiser address.
This will compromise the privacy of the device, so care must be taken when using this option.
The address used for advertising will not be the same as returned by bt_le_oob_get_local, instead bt_id_get should be used to get the LE address.

Advertise using GAP device name. Include the GAP device name automatically when advertising. By default the GAP device name is put at the end of the scan response data. When advertising using @ref BT_LE_ADV_OPT_EXT_ADV and not @ref BT_LE_ADV_OPT_SCANNABLE then it will be put at the end of the advertising data. If the GAP device name does not fit into advertising data it will be converted to a shortened name if possible. @ref BT_LE_ADV_OPT_FORCE_NAME_IN_AD can be used to force the device name to appear in the advertising data of an advert with scan response data.
The application can set the device name itself by including the following in the advertising data. @code BT_DATA(BT_DATA_NAME_COMPLETE, name, sizeof(name) - 1) @endcode
Use low duty directed advertising mode, otherwise high duty mode will be used.

Enable use of Resolvable Private Address (RPA) as the target address in directed advertisements. This is required if the remote device is privacy-enabled and supports address resolution of the target address in directed advertisement. It is the responsibility of the application to check that the remote device supports address resolution of directed advertisements by reading its Central Address Resolution characteristic.
Use filter accept list to filter devices that can request scan response data.
Use filter accept list to filter devices that can connect.
Notify the application when a scan response data has been sent to an active scanner.

When used together with BT_LE_ADV_OPT_EXT_ADV then this option cannot be used together with the BT_LE_ADV_OPT_CONNECTABLE option. When used together with BT_LE_ADV_OPT_EXT_ADV then scan response data must be set.

This options enables extended advertising in the advertising set. In extended advertising the advertising set will send a small header packet on the three primary advertising channels. This small header points to the advertising data packet that will be sent on one of the 37 secondary advertising channels. The advertiser will send primary advertising on LE 1M PHY, and secondary advertising on LE 2M PHY. Connections will be established on LE 2M PHY.
Without this option the advertiser will send advertising data on the three primary advertising channels.

simplesect.para: Enabling this option requires extended advertising support in the peer devices scanning for advertisement packets.

briefdescription.para: Disable use of LE 2M PHY on the secondary advertising channel.

detaileddescription.para: Disabling the use of LE 2M PHY could be necessary if scanners don't support the LE 2M PHY. The advertiser will send primary advertising on LE 1M PHY, and secondary advertising on LE 1M PHY. Connections will be established on LE 1M PHY.

simplesect.para: Cannot be set if BT_LE_ADV_OPT_CODED is set.
Requires BT_LE_ADV_OPT_EXT_ADV.

briefdescription.para: Advertise on the LE Coded PHY (Long Range).

detaileddescription.para: The advertiser will send both primary and secondary advertising on the LE Coded PHY. This gives the advertiser increased range with the trade-off of lower data rate and higher power consumption. Connections will be established on LE Coded PHY.

simplesect.para: Requires BT_LE_ADV_OPT_EXT_ADV

briefdescription.para: Advertise without a device address (identity or RPA).

simplesect.para: Requires BT_LE_ADV_OPT_EXT_ADV
Requires BT_LE_ADV_OPT_EXT_ADV

detaileddescription.para: Disable advertising on channel index 37.
Disable advertising on channel index 38.
Disable advertising on channel index 39.

briefdescription.para: Put GAP device name into advert data.

detaileddescription.para: Will place the GAP device name into the advertising data rather than the scan response data.

simplesect.para: Requires BT_LE_ADV_OPT_USE_NAME

detaileddescription.para: Advertising options
Convenience value when no options are specified.

simplesect.para: Requires BT_LE_ADV_OPT_EXT_ADV

detaileddescription.para: Periodic Advertising options
Convenience value when no options are specified.

briefdescription.para: Use the periodic advertising list to sync with advertiser.

detaileddescription.para: When this option is set, the address and SID of the parameters are ignored.
No advertisement reports will be handled until enabled.
Filter duplicate Periodic Advertising reports
Sync with Angle of Arrival (AoA) constant tone extension
Sync with Angle of Departure (AoD) 1 us constant tone extension
Sync with Angle of Departure (AoD) 2 us constant tone extension
Do not sync to packets without a constant tone extension
Periodic advertising sync options
Convenience value when no options are specified.
Do not sync with Angle of Arrival (AoA) constant tone extension
Do not sync with Angle of Departure (AoD) 1 us constant tone extension
Do not sync with Angle of Departure (AoD) 2 us constant tone extension
Only sync to packets with constant tone extension
Periodic Advertising Sync Transfer options
Convenience value when no options are specified.
Filter duplicates.
Filter using filter accept list.
Enable scan on coded PHY (Long Range).

simplesect.para: Requires BT_LE_SCAN_OPT_CODED.

detaileddescription.para: Scan without requesting additional information from advertisers.
Scan and request additional information from advertisers.

briefdescription.para: Callback for notifying that Bluetooth has been enabled.

parameterdescription.para: zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (const bt_addr_le_t *addr, int8_t rssi, uint8_t adv_type, struct net_buf_simple *buf)
memberdef.name: bt_le_scan_cb_t

briefdescription.para: Callback type for reporting LE scan results.

detaileddescription.para: A function of this type is given to the bt_le_scan_start() function and will be called for any discovered LE device.

parameterdescription.para: Type of advertising response from advertiser.

briefdescription.para: Callback type for reporting BR/EDR discovery (inquiry) results.

detaileddescription.para: A callback of this type is given to the bt_br_discovery_start() function and will be called at the end of the discovery with information about found devices populated in the results array.
Enable Bluetooth. Must be the called before any calls that require communication with the local Bluetooth hardware.

When embed:rst:inline :kconfig:option:`CONFIG_BT_SETTINGS` is enabled, the application must load the Bluetooth settings after this API call successfully completes before Bluetooth APIs can be used. Loading the settings before calling this function is insufficient. Bluetooth settings can be loaded with settings_load() or settings_load_subtree() with argument "bt". The latter selectively loads only Bluetooth settings and is recommended if settings_load() has been called earlier.

parameterdescription.para: Callback to notify completion or NULL to perform the enabling synchronously.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Set Bluetooth GAP Device Name.
When advertising with device name in the advertising data the name should be updated by calling bt_le_adv_update_data or bt_le_ext_adv_set_data.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Get Bluetooth GAP Device Name.

simplesect.para: Bluetooth Device Name

detaileddescription.para: Returns an array of the currently configured identity addresses. To make sure all available identities can be retrieved, the number of elements in the addrs array should be CONFIG_BT_ID_MAX. The identity identifier that some APIs expect (such as advertising parameters) is simply the index of the identity in the addrs array.
If addrs is passed as NULL, then returned count contains the count of all available identities that can be retrieved with a subsequent call to this function with non-NULL addrs parameter.

simplesect.para: Deleted identities may show up as BT_LE_ADDR_ANY in the returned array.

parameterdescription.para: Array where to store the configured identities.
Should be initialized to the array size. Once the function returns it will contain the number of returned identities.

detaileddescription.para: Create a new identity using the given address and IRK. This function can be called before calling bt_enable(), in which case it can be used to override the controller's public address (in case it has one). However, the new identity will only be stored persistently in flash when this API is used after bt_enable(). The reason is that the persistent settings are loaded after bt_enable() and would therefore cause potential conflicts with the stack blindly overwriting what's stored in flash. The identity will also not be written to flash in case a pre-defined address is provided, since in such a situation the app clearly has some place it got the address from and will be able to repeat the procedure on every power cycle, i.e. it would be redundant to also store the information in flash.
Generating random static address or random IRK is not supported when calling this function before bt_enable().

If the application wants to have the stack randomly generate identities and store them in flash for later recovery, the way to do it would be to first initialize the stack (using bt_enable), then call settings_load(), and after that check with bt_id_get() how many identities were recovered. If an insufficient amount of identities were recovered the app may then call bt_id_create() to create new ones.

parameterdescription.para: Address to use for the new identity. If NULL or initialized to BT_ADDR_LE_ANY the stack will generate a new random static address for the identity and copy it to the given parameter upon return from this function (in case the parameter was non-NULL).

Identity Resolving Key (16 bytes) to be used with this identity. If set to all zeroes or NULL, the stack will generate a random IRK for the identity and copy it back to the parameter upon return from this function (in case the parameter was non-NULL). If privacy embed:rst:inline :kconfig:option:`CONFIG_BT_PRIVACY` is not enabled this parameter must be NULL.

simplesect.para: Identity identifier (>= 0) in case of success, or a negative error code on failure.

detaileddescription.para: The semantics of the addr and irk parameters of this function are the same as with bt_id_create(). The difference is the first id parameter that needs to be an existing identity (if it doesn't exist this function will return an error). When given an existing identity this function will disconnect any connections created using it, remove any pairing keys or other data associated with it, and then create a new identity in the same slot, based on the addr and irk parameters.

simplesect.para: the default identity (BT_ID_DEFAULT) cannot be reset, i.e. this API will return an error if asked to do that.

parameterdescription.para: Address to use for the new identity. If NULL or initialized to BT_ADDR_LE_ANY the stack will generate a new static random address for the identity and copy it to the given parameter upon return from this function (in case the parameter was non-NULL).

Identity Resolving Key (16 bytes) to be used with this identity. If set to all zeroes or NULL, the stack will generate a random IRK for the identity and copy it back to the parameter upon return from this function (in case the parameter was non-NULL). If privacy embed:rst:inline :kconfig:option:`CONFIG_BT_PRIVACY` is not enabled this parameter must be NULL.

simplesect.para: Identity identifier (>= 0) in case of success, or a negative error code on failure.

detaileddescription.para: When given a valid identity this function will disconnect any connections created using it, remove any pairing keys or other data associated with it, and then flag is as deleted, so that it can not be used for any operations. To take back into use the slot the identity was occupying the bt_id_reset() API needs to be used.

simplesect.para: the default identity (BT_ID_DEFAULT) cannot be deleted, i.e. this API will return an error if asked to do that.
0 in case of success, or a negative error code on failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct bt_le_adv_param *param, const struct bt_data *ad, size_t ad_len, const struct bt_data *sd, size_t sd_len)
memberdef.name: bt_le_adv_start

detaileddescription.para: Set advertisement data, scan response data, advertisement parameters and start advertising.

When the advertisement parameter peer address has been set the advertising will be directed to the peer. In this case advertisement data and scan response data parameters are ignored. If the mode is high duty cycle the timeout will be BT_GAP_ADV_HIGH_DUTY_CYCLE_MAX_TIMEOUT.

parameterdescription.para: Data to be used in advertisement packets.
Data to be used in scan response packets.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.
-ENOMEM No free connection objects available for connectable advertiser.

-ECONNREFUSED When connectable advertising is requested and there is already maximum number of connections established in the controller. This error code is only guaranteed when using Zephyr controller, for other controllers code returned in this case may be -EIO.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct bt_data *ad, size_t ad_len, const struct bt_data *sd, size_t sd_len)
memberdef.name: bt_le_adv_update_data

detaileddescription.para: Update advertisement and scan response data.

parameterdescription.para: Data to be used in advertisement packets.
Data to be used in scan response packets.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Stops ongoing advertising.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct bt_le_adv_param *param, const struct bt_le_ext_adv_cb *cb, struct bt_le_ext_adv **adv)
memberdef.name: bt_le_ext_adv_create

detaileddescription.para: Create a new advertising set and set advertising parameters. Advertising parameters can be updated with bt_le_ext_adv_update_param.

parameterdescription.para: Callback struct to notify about advertiser activity. Can be NULL. Must point to valid memory during the lifetime of the advertising set.
Valid advertising set object on success.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Start advertising with the given advertising set.

detaileddescription.para: If the advertiser is limited by either the timeout or number of advertising events the application will be notified by the advertiser sent callback once the limit is reached. If the advertiser is limited by both the timeout and the number of advertising events then the limit that is reached first will stop the advertiser.

briefdescription.para: Stop advertising with the given advertising set.

detaileddescription.para: Stop advertising with a specific advertising set. When using this function the advertising sent callback will not be called.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct bt_le_ext_adv *adv, const struct bt_data *ad, size_t ad_len, const struct bt_data *sd, size_t sd_len)
memberdef.name: bt_le_ext_adv_set_data

briefdescription.para: Set an advertising set's advertising or scan response data.

detaileddescription.para: Set advertisement data or scan response data. If the advertising set is currently advertising then the advertising data will be updated in subsequent advertising events.
When both BT_LE_ADV_OPT_EXT_ADV and BT_LE_ADV_OPT_SCANNABLE are enabled then advertising data is ignored. When BT_LE_ADV_OPT_SCANNABLE is not enabled then scan response data is ignored.

If the advertising set has been configured to send advertising data on the primary advertising channels then the maximum data length is BT_GAP_ADV_MAX_ADV_DATA_LEN bytes. If the advertising set has been configured for extended advertising, then the maximum data length is defined by the controller with the maximum possible of BT_GAP_ADV_MAX_EXT_ADV_DATA_LEN bytes.

simplesect.para: Not all scanners support extended data length advertising data.

When updating the advertising data while advertising the advertising data and scan response data length must be smaller or equal to what can be fit in a single advertising packet. Otherwise the advertiser must be stopped.

parameterdescription.para: Data to be used in advertisement packets.
Data to be used in scan response packets.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Update the advertising parameters. The function will return an error if the advertiser set is currently advertising. Stop the advertising set before calling this function.

simplesect.para: When changing the option BT_LE_ADV_OPT_USE_NAME then bt_le_ext_adv_set_data needs to be called in order to update the advertising data and scan response data.
Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Delete advertising set. This will free up the advertising set and make it possible to create a new advertising set.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get array index of an advertising set.

detaileddescription.para: This function is used to map bt_adv to index of an array of advertising sets. The array has CONFIG_BT_EXT_ADV_MAX_ADV_SET elements.

simplesect.para: Index of the advertising set object. The range of the returned value is 0..CONFIG_BT_EXT_ADV_MAX_ADV_SET-1
Zero on success or (negative) error code on failure.

briefdescription.para: Set or update the periodic advertising parameters.

detaileddescription.para: The periodic advertising parameters can only be set or updated on an extended advertisement set which is neither scannable, connectable nor anonymous.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct bt_le_ext_adv *adv, const struct bt_data *ad, size_t ad_len)
memberdef.name: bt_le_per_adv_set_data

briefdescription.para: Set or update the periodic advertising data.

detaileddescription.para: The periodic advertisement data can only be set or updated on an extended advertisement set which is neither scannable, connectable nor anonymous.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Enabling the periodic advertising can be done independently of extended advertising, but both periodic advertising and extended advertising shall be enabled before any periodic advertising data is sent. The periodic advertising and extended advertising can be enabled in any order.

Once periodic advertising has been enabled, it will continue advertising until bt_le_per_adv_stop() has been called, or if the advertising set is deleted by bt_le_ext_adv_delete(). Calling bt_le_ext_adv_stop() will not stop the periodic advertising.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Disabling the periodic advertising can be done independently of extended advertising. Disabling periodic advertising will not disable extended advertising.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get array index of an periodic advertising sync object.

detaileddescription.para: This function is get the index of an array of periodic advertising sync objects. The array has CONFIG_BT_PER_ADV_SYNC_MAX elements.

simplesect.para: Index of the periodic advertising sync object. The range of the returned value is 0..CONFIG_BT_PER_ADV_SYNC_MAX-1
Zero on success or (negative) error code on failure.

briefdescription.para: Look up an existing periodic advertising sync object by advertiser address.

simplesect.para: Periodic advertising sync object or NULL if not found.

briefdescription.para: Create a periodic advertising sync object.

detaileddescription.para: Create a periodic advertising sync object that can try to synchronize to periodic advertising reports from an advertiser. Scan shall either be disabled or extended scan shall be enabled.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Delete the periodic advertising sync object. Can be called regardless of the state of the sync. If the syncing is currently syncing, the syncing is cancelled. If the sync has been established, it is terminated. The periodic advertising sync object will be invalidated afterwards.
If the state of the sync object is syncing, then a new periodic advertising sync object may not be created until the controller has finished canceling this object.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Adds the callback structure to the list of callback structures for periodic adverising syncs.
This callback will be called for all periodic advertising sync activity, such as synced, terminated and when data is received.

parameterdescription.para: Callback struct. Must point to memory that remains valid.

briefdescription.para: Enables receiving periodic advertising reports for a sync.

detaileddescription.para: If the sync is already receiving the reports, -EALREADY is returned.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Disables receiving periodic advertising reports for a sync.

detaileddescription.para: If the sync report receiving is already disabled, -EALREADY is returned.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct bt_le_per_adv_sync *per_adv_sync, const struct bt_conn *conn, uint16_t service_data)
memberdef.name: bt_le_per_adv_sync_transfer

briefdescription.para: Transfer the periodic advertising sync information to a peer device.

detaileddescription.para: This will allow another device to quickly synchronize to the same periodic advertising train that this device is currently synced to.

parameterdescription.para: The periodic advertising sync to transfer.
The peer device that will receive the sync information.
Application service data provided to the remote host.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct bt_le_ext_adv *adv, const struct bt_conn *conn, uint16_t service_data)
memberdef.name: bt_le_per_adv_set_info_transfer

briefdescription.para: Transfer the information about a periodic advertising set.

detaileddescription.para: This will allow another device to quickly synchronize to periodic advertising set from this device.

parameterdescription.para: The periodic advertising set to transfer info of.
The peer device that will receive the information.
Application service data provided to the remote host.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Subscribe to periodic advertising sync transfers (PASTs).

detaileddescription.para: Sets the parameters and allow other devices to transfer periodic advertising syncs.

parameterdescription.para: The connection to set the parameters for. If NULL default parameters for all connections will be set. Parameters set for specific connection will always have precedence.
The periodic advertising sync transfer parameters.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Unsubscribe from periodic advertising sync transfers (PASTs).

detaileddescription.para: Remove the parameters that allow other devices to transfer periodic advertising syncs.

parameterdescription.para: The connection to remove the parameters for. If NULL default parameters for all connections will be removed. Unsubscribing for a specific device, will still allow other devices to transfer periodic advertising syncs.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Add a device to the periodic advertising list.

detaileddescription.para: Add peer device LE address to the periodic advertising list. This will make it possibly to automatically create a periodic advertising sync to this device.

parameterdescription.para: The advertising set ID. This value is obtained from the bt_le_scan_recv_info in the scan callback.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Remove a device from the periodic advertising list.

detaileddescription.para: Removes peer device LE address from the periodic advertising list.

parameterdescription.para: The advertising set ID. This value is obtained from the bt_le_scan_recv_info in the scan callback.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Clears the entire periodic advertising list.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Start LE scanning with given parameters and provide results through the specified callback.

simplesect.para: The LE scanner by default does not use the Identity Address of the local device when embed:rst:inline :kconfig:option:`CONFIG_BT_PRIVACY` is disabled. This is to prevent the active scanner from disclosing the identity information when requesting additional information from advertisers. In order to enable directed advertiser reports then embed:rst:inline :kconfig:option:`CONFIG_BT_SCAN_WITH_IDENTITY` must be enabled.

parameterdescription.para: Callback to notify scan results. May be NULL if callback registration through bt_le_scan_cb_register is preferred.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or error code otherwise, positive in case of protocol error or negative (POSIX) in case of stack internal error.

detaileddescription.para: Stops ongoing LE scanning.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or error code otherwise, positive in case of protocol error or negative (POSIX) in case of stack internal error.

detaileddescription.para: Adds the callback structure to the list of callback structures that monitors scanner activity.
This callback will be called for all scanner activity, regardless of what API was used to start the scanner.

parameterdescription.para: Callback struct. Must point to memory that remains valid.

detaileddescription.para: Remove the callback structure from the list of scanner callbacks.

parameterdescription.para: Callback struct. Must point to memory that remains valid.

briefdescription.para: Add device (LE) to filter accept list.

detaileddescription.para: Add peer device LE address to the filter accept list.

simplesect.para: The filter accept list cannot be modified when an LE role is using the filter accept list, i.e advertiser or scanner using a filter accept list or automatic connecting to devices using filter accept list.
Zero on success or error code otherwise, positive in case of protocol error or negative (POSIX) in case of stack internal error.

briefdescription.para: Remove device (LE) from filter accept list.

detaileddescription.para: Remove peer device LE address from the filter accept list.

simplesect.para: The filter accept list cannot be modified when an LE role is using the filter accept list, i.e advertiser or scanner using a filter accept list or automatic connecting to devices using filter accept list.
Zero on success or error code otherwise, positive in case of protocol error or negative (POSIX) in case of stack internal error.

detaileddescription.para: Clear all devices from the filter accept list.

simplesect.para: The filter accept list cannot be modified when an LE role is using the filter accept list, i.e advertiser or scanner using a filter accept list or automatic connecting to devices using filter accept list.
Zero on success or error code otherwise, positive in case of protocol error or negative (POSIX) in case of stack internal error.
Zero on success or error code otherwise, positive in case of protocol error or negative (POSIX) in case of stack internal error.

briefdescription.para: Helper for parsing advertising (or EIR or OOB) data.

detaileddescription.para: A helper for parsing the basic data types used for Extended Inquiry Response (EIR), Advertising Data (AD), and OOB data blocks. The most common scenario is to call this helper on the advertising data received in the callback that was given to bt_le_scan_start().

parameterdescription.para: Advertising data as given to the bt_le_scan_cb_t callback.
Callback function which will be called for each element that's found in the data. The callback should return true to continue parsing, or false to stop parsing.
User data to be passed to the callback.

briefdescription.para: Get local LE Out of Band (OOB) information.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows to get local information that are useful for Out of Band pairing or connection creation.

If privacy embed:rst:inline :kconfig:option:`CONFIG_BT_PRIVACY` is enabled this will result in generating new Resolvable Private Address (RPA) that is valid for embed:rst:inline :kconfig:option:`CONFIG_BT_RPA_TIMEOUT` seconds. This address will be used for advertising started by bt_le_adv_start, active scanning and connection creation.

simplesect.para:
If privacy is enabled the RPA cannot be refreshed in the following cases:
Creating a connection in progress, wait for the connected callback. In addition when extended advertising embed:rst:inline :kconfig:option:`CONFIG_BT_EXT_ADV` is not enabled or not supported by the controller:
Advertiser is enabled using a Random Static Identity Address for a different local identity.
The local identity conflicts with the local identity used by other roles.

parameterdescription.para: Local identity, in most cases BT_ID_DEFAULT.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or error code otherwise, positive in case of protocol error or negative (POSIX) in case of stack internal error.

briefdescription.para: Get local LE Out of Band (OOB) information.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows to get local information that are useful for Out of Band pairing or connection creation.

If privacy embed:rst:inline :kconfig:option:`CONFIG_BT_PRIVACY` is enabled this will result in generating new Resolvable Private Address (RPA) that is valid for embed:rst:inline :kconfig:option:`CONFIG_BT_RPA_TIMEOUT` seconds. This address will be used by the advertising set.

simplesect.para: When generating OOB information for multiple advertising set all OOB information needs to be generated at the same time.

If privacy is enabled the RPA cannot be refreshed in the following cases:
Creating a connection in progress, wait for the connected callback.
Zero on success or error code otherwise, positive in case of protocol error or negative (POSIX) in case of stack internal error.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct bt_br_discovery_param *param, struct bt_br_discovery_result *results, size_t count, bt_br_discovery_cb_t cb)
memberdef.name: bt_br_discovery_start

detaileddescription.para: Start BR/EDR discovery (inquiry) and provide results through the specified callback. When bt_br_discovery_cb_t is called it indicates that discovery has completed. If more inquiry results were received during session than fits in provided result storage, only ones with highest RSSI will be reported.

parameterdescription.para: Number of results in storage. Valid range: 1-255.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or error code otherwise, positive in case of protocol error or negative (POSIX) in case of stack internal error

detaileddescription.para: Stops ongoing BR/EDR discovery. If discovery was stopped by this call results won't be reported

simplesect.para: Zero on success or error code otherwise, positive in case of protocol error or negative (POSIX) in case of stack internal error.

briefdescription.para: Get BR/EDR local Out Of Band information.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows to get local controller information that are useful for Out Of Band pairing or connection creation process.

briefdescription.para: Enable/disable set controller in discoverable state.

detaileddescription.para: Allows make local controller to listen on INQUIRY SCAN channel and responds to devices making general inquiry. To enable this state it's mandatory to first be in connectable state.

parameterdescription.para: Value allowing/disallowing controller to become discoverable.

simplesect.para: Negative if fail set to requested state or requested state has been already set. Zero if done successfully.

briefdescription.para: Enable/disable set controller in connectable state.

detaileddescription.para: Allows make local controller to be connectable. It means the controller start listen to devices requests on PAGE SCAN channel. If disabled also resets discoverability if was set.

parameterdescription.para: Value allowing/disallowing controller to be connectable.

simplesect.para: Negative if fail set to requested state or requested state has been already set. Zero if done successfully.

parameterdescription.para: Remote address, NULL or BT_ADDR_LE_ANY to clear all remote devices.

simplesect.para: 0 on success or negative error value on failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t id, void(*func)(const struct bt_bond_info *info, void *user_data), void *user_data)
memberdef.name: bt_foreach_bond

parameterdescription.para: Function to call for each bond.
Data to pass to the callback function.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t dir, uint8_t id, uint8_t vs_config_len, const uint8_t *vs_config)
memberdef.name: bt_configure_data_path

detaileddescription.para: Request the Controller to configure the data transport path in a given direction between the Controller and the Host.

parameterdescription.para: Direction to be configured, BT_HCI_DATAPATH_DIR_HOST_TO_CTLR or BT_HCI_DATAPATH_DIR_CTLR_TO_HOST
Vendor specific logical transport channel ID, range [BT_HCI_DATAPATH_ID_VS..BT_HCI_DATAPATH_ID_VS_END]
Length of additional vendor specific configuration data
Pointer to additional vendor specific configuration data

simplesect.para: 0 in case of success or negative value in case of error.
